explanation: The code checked only three rotations (90°, 180°, 270°) because the loop used range(3), so the original 0° orientation was never tested. Changing the loop to range(4) makes the code test all four possible orientations (0°, 90°, 180°, 270°) — the fourth iteration effectively checks the original orientation after four rotations — fixing the bug with a single-line change.
